'Kami maafkan Aiman...' [METROTV]
05 Nov 2019, 21:30 by Alias Abd Rani



“KAMI maafkan adik Aiman,” itu reaksi Pengasas Unit Khas Van Jenazah (UKVJ) Mohd Hirwan Aiyub susulan seorang kanak-kanak yang dikenali sebagai Aiman, 14, yang membuat panggilan palsu pada Jumaat lalu.
Kanak-kanak orang kurang upaya (OKU) itu membuat panggilan pada 5.11 petang dengan meminta sukarelawan UKVJ mengambil jenazah kakaknya yang baru meninggal dunia di Hospital Serdang untuk dibawa pulang ke Kedah.
Secara kebetulan, sukarelawan terbabit menghadiri majlis akad nikah seorang daripada mereka menyebabkan kumpulan terbabit terpaksa meninggalkan majlis dan bergegas ke hospital.
Mohd Hirwan atau lebih dikenali sebagai Wan Cai berkata, pihaknya kemudiannya mendapati tiada sesiapa meninggal di hospital berkenaan pada hari itu dan siasatan juga mendapati nama yang diberikan adalah ibu kepada kanak-kanak terbabit yang sudah meninggal dunia hampir setahun lalu.
Menurutnya lagi, pada awalnya mereka menyangka seorang wanita yang membuat panggilan berdasarkan suaranya tetapi maklumat diterima individu terbabit adalah Aiman.
“Kami menyangkakan ada pihak cuba mempermainkan sukarelawan UKVJ lalu membuat laporan polis.
“Susulan laporan itu, bapa angkat bersama saudara terdekat kanak-kanak istimewa itu datang menemui sukarelawan untuk membuat permohonan maaf.
“Apabila diberitahu perkara sebenar, barulah kami faham dan kemungkinan Aiman terlalu merindui arwah ibunya menyebabkan dia berbuat demikian,” katanya ketika dihubungi hari ini.
Berdasarkan maklumat daripada ahli keluarganya, kanak-kanak itu dipercayai terlalu obses dalam hal berkaitan pengurusan jenazah.
Berikutan itu, sukarelawan UKVJ memberi peluang kepada Aiman untuk bersama menguruskan jenazah yang meninggal dunia hari ini di Hospital Tengku Ampuan Rahimah (HTAR), Klang.
“Mungkin rezeki dia (Aiman) hari ini apabila kami terima panggilan terdapat kematian di HTAR. Ketika itu, kami bersama Aiman dan keluarganya lalu sepakat membawanya bersama untuk mengambil jenazah untuk dikebumikan.
“Kami beri peluang kepadanya kerana memahami kehendaknya walaupun dia tidak seperti kanak-kanak lain. Minat terhadap pengurusan jenazah membuatkan kami kagum dengannya,” katanya sambil memaklumkan Aiman dan keluarga menetap di Bahau, Negeri Sembilan.
Terdahulu Wan Cai memuat naik status menerusi FB Wan Cai Official.
“Kebetulan kami hendak uruskan satu jenazah dan bawa sekali adik Aiman. Jika anda ingin tahu Aiman terlalu obses dengan pengurusan jenazah, cuma dia tidak diberi kesempatan.
“Jadi, oleh kerana sudah tertulis hari ini rezeki untuk adik Aiman, saya arahkan supaya dia dibawa bersama untuk mengambil jenazah di bilik forensik HTAR. Semoga pengalaman yang diterima adik ini dapat memberi kepuasan kepadanya. Hari ini hasrat anak syurga ini kami tunaikan!,” katanya menerusi status berkenaan.
Pada masa sama, pihaknya turut membuat rakaman langsung menerusi FB permohonan maaf daripada Aiman.


Aiman (dua dari kanan) bersama sukarelawan UKVJ di HTAR Klang hari ini. Foto Ihsan UKVJ

'We're sorry Aiman ...' [METROTV]
05 Nov 2019, 21:30 by Alias Abd Rani



"We apologize Aiman's sister," was the reaction of Van Vena's Special Unit (UKVJ) chief Mohd Hirwan Aiyub following a child known as Aiman, 14, who made a false call on Friday.
Children of people with disabilities (PWDs) call at 5:11 that evening by asking volunteers took the body UKVJ new sister died at the Serdang Hospital to take home to Kedah.
Coincidentally, the volunteers attended one of their wedding ceremonies and the group had to leave and rush to the hospital.
Mohd Hirwan, also known as Wan Cai, said he later found that no one had died in the hospital that day and that the investigation had found the name of the mother of the child who had died almost a year ago.
According to him, they initially thought a woman made the call based on her voice but the information received by the individual was Aiman.
“We suspect that some people are trying to fool the UKVJ volunteers and make a police report.
“Following the report, the adoptive father and the close relatives of the special children came to volunteer to apologize.
"When we were told the truth, we only understood and it was possible for Aiman to miss his mother's soul so much that he did so," he said when contacted today.
According to information from his family members, the child is believed to be overly obese when it comes to body management.
Following this, UKVJ volunteers gave Aiman the opportunity to jointly manage the deceased's body today at Tengku Ampuan Rahimah Hospital (HTAR) in Klang.
“It may be his (Aiman's) fortune today when we receive a call for death at HTAR. At that time, we were with Aiman and his family and agreed to take him along to retrieve his body for burial.
“We gave him a chance to understand his will even though he was not like any other kid. His interest in the management of the remains has amazed us, ”he said, noting Aiman and his family settled in Bahau, Negeri Sembilan.
Wan Cai previously uploaded the status through FB Wan Cai Official.
“Coincidentally, we wanted to handle one body and bring Aiman's sister back. If you want to know Aiman is too obsessed with corpse management, he is just not given the chance.
"So, since it was written today that provision for Aiman's sister, I have directed her to be taken to the HTAR forensic room. Hopefully the experience that this little sister has will give her satisfaction. Today is the wish of our heavenly child! ”He said through the status quo.
At the same time, he also made a live recording through FB's apology from Aiman.


Aiman (second from right) with UKVJ volunteers at HTAR Klang today. Photo courtesy of UKVJ
